dt: {bc}any of the light, horny, epidermal outgrowths that form the external covering of the body of birds

Feathers include the smaller {d_link|down|down:7} feathers and the larger {d_link|contour|contour feather} and {d_link|flight|flight feather} feathers. Larger feathers consist of a shaft ({d_link|rachis|rachis}) bearing branches ({d_link|barbs|barb:1}) which bear smaller branches ({d_link|barbules|barbule}). These smaller branches bear tiny hook-bearing processes ({d_link|barbicels|barbicel}) which interlock with the barbules of an adjacent barb to link the barbs into a continuous stiff {d_link|vane|vane}. Down feathers lack barbules, resulting in fluffy feathers which provide insulation below the contour feathers.
{bc}a projecting strip, rib, fin, or flange
{bc}a {a_link|feathery} flaw in the eye or in a precious stone

art.capt: feather 1a: {it}A: 1{/it} quill, {it}2{/it} vane; {it}B: 1{/it} barb, {it}2{/it} barbule, {it}3{/it} barbicel with hamulus
